intro: Sonchus pustulatus, commonly known as the roughleaf sowthistle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring hairy, lobed leaves that are often covered in small, raised bumps. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which are followed by spiny, bristly seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Botanically, it belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts.
